intro: Dianthera secunda var. holtonii, commonly known as the Holton's dianthera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are usually pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
